text: my name is Nicole Umbra I'm the CFO for
venture garden group managing partner
for green house capital which is our
investment arm and founder of green
house lab which is Nigeria's first
female focus tech accelerator primarily
we focus on FinTech investments just
because it's the type of company that we
run ourselves and so it's much easier
for us to understand the FinTech space
and be able to readily assess these
solutions that you know some of these
startups are coming up with but we also
have companies across power across
healthcare across education and they're
in line with our companies that we have
at vgg because they're things were
interested in and really just solving
all these different problems that
Nigeria has using technology as an
enabler there's ways that being in
Africa being pan-african and adapting
for that can help you be ready for the
rest of the world and so we look for
entrepreneurs that have a good
understanding of how they can take their
technology and move it across if you
literally make it in our small customer
of the world you can definitely make it
anywhere we looked across our portfolio
and saw that not a lot of women of the
businesses had women co-founders and so
we wanted to go out and prove that that
can't be the case because if you look at
the data women led businesses produce at
least 30 percent higher ROI they do a
lot more with a lot less outside funding
or even internal funding they don't have
as much access to these groups and these
you know country clubs the things that
men have as these natural networking
settings and so you're saying with less
resources women are still producing more
so green house lab we said let's find
these women that are using technology to
solve their regular problems that they
face in their lives and then we now
bridge that gap for them so we help them
with their confidence we help them with
their numbers we help them with their
strategy all those areas that investors
are going to drill down on to determine
if they're actually bankable but on the
other side we work with investors for to
do like implicit bias training so that
way we also make them more conscious
about the types of questions that they
might ask male co-founders versus what
they would ask women co-founders and so
how do we now help both sides get there
right so that way they are not more
confident know their
burries know how to say articulate the
business is bankable but investors are
also now more open and more receptive to
being able to see how they fit into
their portfolio so we feel like the the
potential here on the continent is is so
untapped and so when we actually look at
people we're saying you don't have
competitors yet you just need to resize
the pie so we're saying there's actually
plenty of room for people to grow and we
want international investors bringing
their money into Africa to really grow
and harness all of these services here
while now exporting our talent in terms
of brain dry in terms of the technology
that we have and using that to enable
the rest of the world the same way we
would have AWS powering all of our
businesses here why can't we have
something created on the continent that
can also help power businesses around
the world
